Description: Fragment of lid of Attic black-figured pottery pyxis, probably of Nikosthenic type. Interior glazed black with trace of band in added red; exterior: horse gallopping to right (forelegs with some added red remaining) following running male, seemingly unclad (buttock and right leg; quiver behing him with added red); star rosette as filling ornament; three narrow lines to the outside; then lotus bud chain with dots.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "24" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other AM1371 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1969)
